jobs.title: (Senior) Cyber Security Expert – Incident Response (m/f/x)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Eye Security

Eye Security is providing cybersecurity with embedded cyber insurance solutions for organizations in Europe. Headquartered in the Netherlands, we are already over 170 FTEs and continue to grow internationally.

We combine cutting-edge technology with hands-on expertise to detect, respond to, and recover from cyber threats in real time. Our team brings together talent from intelligence, military, tech, and consulting backgrounds — all united by a shared mission: to make enterprise-grade cybersecurity accessible to every business, not just the big players.

At Eye, you’ll work on projects with an international footprint, solving real-world challenges and helping to build a safer digital future for our clients.

About this role

As part of our expansion in the Benelux and DACH regions, we are seeking a (Senior) Cyber Security Expert (m/f/x) to perform Incident Response for clients facing (potential) cyber incidents. Additionally, you will collaborate with the Managed Detection and Response (MDR) team, ensuring that our clients stay safe.

The MDR & IR team supports our customers in the Security Operations Center (SOC) around the clock and is ready to provide IR services when needed. Our multidisciplinary IR experts support our clients with (potential) cybercrime incidents, such as business email compromise, ransomware attacks, and espionage.

What you will do

• Incident Response: Respond to cyber incidents remotely (and occasionally on-site, if necessary). Communicate calmly and clearly with clients, guiding them through every step of the response process.

• Domain Expertise: Use your knowledge of operating systems (Windows, Linux, Mac), cloud infrastructures (Microsoft 365, Azure, AWS, Google Cloud), and network security to analyze and mitigate threats.

• Collaboration: Support MDR workflows, triage security alerts as part of a 24/7 on-call rotation (approx. once per week) and engage with cross-regional teams to maintain quality as we scale.

• Continuous Improvement: Develop and refine internal playbooks, processes, and tooling. Contribute to initiatives like research projects, threat intelligence, and automation tools.

• Leadership: Coordinate with internal and external stakeholders, such as colleagues, lawyers, data recovery specialists, and law enforcement, to manage incidents effectively.

What you will need

• Track Record in Cybersecurity: Proven background in Incident Response (IR), Digital Forensics and Incident Response (DFIR), or threat intelligence. Experience in conducting forensic investigations and managing IR cases.

• Hands-on experience with cybersecurity tools like Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) products (e.g., CrowdStrike Falcon, SentinelOne, Windows Defender for Endpoint). Proficiency in programming/scripting languages to automate response tasks or analyze evidence is a plus.

• Excellent communication skills, especially when guiding clients through high-pressure situations.

• Analytical Mindset: A natural curiosity to explore root causes and improve processes, alongside the ability to explain complex technical concepts to stakeholders clearly.

• Team-First Attitude: Comfort working in diverse and neurodivergent environments with humility and collaboration, willing to take on foundational work, including SOC alert triage and documentation.

• Language Skills: Fluency in English and either German or Dutch.

• Flexibility: Availability to participate in 24/7 on-call schedules.

What we offer

• Meaningful Mission: protect organizations across Europe from real-world cyber threats

• Collaborative Culture: work with top-tier professionals from national CERTs, intelligence agencies, and leading tech backgrounds

• Autonomy and Ownership: Shape internal processes and tools while enjoying ownership of your projects.

• Flexibility: A remote-friendly culture with quarterly meetups, annual company retreats (in Spain, Portugal, Italy…) and Thursday socials.

• Generous Time Off: Including wellbeing and volunteering days — because great work starts with time to rest and recharge.

Are you up for it?

We look forward to receiving your application.

jobs.title: Head of Sales DACH / Regional Sales Director DACH
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About The Role & Team

Join us and help build our next phase of growth across the EMEA region. We are looking for a commercially minded and impactful, yet humble and people-driven, Regional Sales Director.

You will take a hands-on approach in managing and developing your team of Account Executives and one SDR. The focus is on driving deal reviews, improving forecast accuracy, enabling strong deal management, and coaching the team to success. In addition, you will actively support your team by joining and helping to close complex deals.

Reporting to the CRO, you will help us establish and drive success across your region as we continue to scale our Field teams over the remainder of 2025 and beyond. The ideal candidate will already be a successful sales leader, with a passion for getting things done and thriving in a fast-paced environment. You will also embrace, embody, and lead with our core values ever present: Ownership, State of the Art, Fun, Impact.

As our RSD, You Will

  • Coach and train your sales team, including running regular deal reviews and supporting pipeline accuracy.

  • Be responsible for your regional GTM strategy, with a strong focus on the SMB segment.

  • Understand and apply the core metrics of the business to improve forecast accuracy and regional performance.

  • Actively support and close key deals – joining calls, meeting customers on-site, and ensuring deal success.

  • Manage and develop your existing team, fostering growth and resilience.

  • Leverage your experience in a partner-driven (MSP) sales model to maximize regional success.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to ensure alignment with marketing and sales engineering.

  • Plan and communicate the growth path in your region, both annually and on an ongoing basis.

  • Be available for monthly PG Days in Duisburg (travel required).

You'll be a great addition to the team if you are:

  • Language Proficiency: Native in German and fluency in English is crucial.

  • Sales Expertise: Extensive experience in sales, with a proven track record of meeting and exceeding sales targets in the DACH market.

  • Leadership Skills: Demonstrated ability to manage and coach a sales team, fostering a positive, results-driven environment.

  • Industry Knowledge: Solid understanding of cybersecurity and the MSP/partner-driven model, with experience in competing and differentiating in a crowded market.

  • Strategic Thinking: Ability to develop and implement robust sales strategies that drive growth and increase market share in the SMB segment.

  • Relationship Management: Strong network of relationships within the industry and the ability to foster and maintain relationships with key stakeholders, including potential partners/resellers.

  • Cultural Awareness: Understanding of the cultural nuances and business practices within the DACH region.

  • Sales Methodologies: Experienced in MEDDIC, MEDDPIC, or similar sales/qualification methodologies.

Why join us?

  • Meaningful Work: Help protect companies across Europe from cyber threats as part of a highly skilled and passionate team

  • Flexible Work Environment: Work fully remotely from anywhere in Germany or choose a hybrid setup from our offices in Berlin or Duisburg

  • Team Culture: Regular meet-ups and a yearly company-wide retreat in inspiring locations like Spain, Portugal, or Italy

  • More than Vacation: Additional paid days for volunteering, personal time off, and well-being

  • Your Setup, Your Choice: Whether you prefer Mac or Windows – you decide what works best for you

jobs.title: MSP Partner Manager (Germany)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Deine Rolle bei Eye
Eye Security ist ein stark wachsendes Cybersicherheits-Scale-up, welches im Jahr 2020 von drei Mitarbeitenden des niederländischen Geheimdienstes gegründet wurde und sich zum Ziel gesetzt hat, die digitalen Werte von KMUs in ganz Europa zu schützen. Mit einem robusten Portfolio unter dem Produktbündel Eye Cyber Guard bietet Eye Security maßgeschneiderte Cybersicherheitslösungen in einem abonnementbasierten SaaS-Modell. Das Angebot reicht von Managed Detection and Response, Incident Response und Attack Surface Management bis hin zu Security Awareness Services und Versicherungen und richtet sich an einen Kundenkreis von über 650 Unternehmen. Derzeit sind bereits über 180 ambitionierte IT Experten (m/w/d) in den Standorten Niederlade, Belgien, Deutschland und Großbritannien für Eye Security tätig.
Als MSP Partner Manager (m/w/d) bist du für den Aufbau unseres Partnerschafts- und Vertriebsnetzes mit sicherheitsorientierten Partnerschaften verantwortlich, um mit und über Managed Service Providers (MSPs) zu verkaufen. Während des gesamten Prozesses liegt der Schwerpunkt auf dem Aufbau und der Pflege von Beziehungen zu unseren Kunden, wobei du dein Netzwerk nutzen wirst, um mit potenziellen Partnern und Kunden in Kontakt zu treten.


Dein Tätigkeitsfeld

  • Du baust unser Partner- und Eye-Vertriebsnetz von Grund auf auf – mit Fokus auf sicherheitsorientierte Partnerschaften.

  • Du gehst aktiv auf potenzielle Partner zu, überzeugst sie von einer Zusammenarbeit und entwickelst daraus ein tragfähiges Netzwerk.

  • Von der Vertragsgestaltung bis zum Geschäftsabschluss bist du die professionelle Unterstützung für unsere Partner

  • Du präsentierst unsere Lösungen auf Messen und Veranstaltungen

  • Eine enge und partnerschaftliche Zusammenarbeit mit deinen Kollegen (m/w/d) aus Vertrieb und Marketing sowie unseren Geschäftsbereichen ist für dich selbstverständlich und die Basis für unseren gemeinsamen Erfolg

  • Du konzipierst, vereinbarst und managst die Partner bei der Umsetzung des gemeinsamen Businessplans

  • Fließende Deutsch und Englisch Kenntnisse sind erforderlich

Dein Profil:

  • Nachweisbare Erfahrung im Aufbau eines Partnernetzwerks von Grund auf

  • Analytische Fähigkeiten und eine solide strategische Planungsfähigkeit

  • Unternehmerisches Denken und Handeln, Teamfähigkeit und das Streben nach Lösungen

  • Fließende Deutsch und Englisch Kenntnisse (mündlich und schriftlich)

  • Sehr gute Präsentations-/ und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten

  • Verständnis für die Cybersicherheitslandschaft und die Fähigkeit, diese in Kunden-/Dienstleistungsmodelle zu integrieren

  • Bereitschaft zu einer Reisetätigkeit von bis zu 40 %.

Was wir bieten

  • Du wirst Teil eines der am schnellsten wachsenden Cybersecurity-Scale-ups in Europa

  • Du wirst eine Schlüsselrolle beim Aufbau einer innovativen Cybersecurity-Produktlinie spielen, in der wir effektive Cybersecurity mit Cyberversicherung auf globaler Ebene kombinieren. Daher stehen dir viele Ressourcen zur Verfügung, die du nutzen kannst, um Eye beim Wachstum zu unterstützen;

  • Ein attraktives Vergütungspaket und Bonus;

  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten;

  • Autokostenzuschuss oder Leasingbudget;

  • Apple iPhone oder Samsung (was du bevorzugst);

  • Eye stellt dir ein Apple MacBook Pro M1 oder ein Dell XPS 4K Laptop zur Verfügung;

  • Deine persönliche und berufliche Entwicklung steht bei Eye an erster Stelle. Wir unterstützen dich aktiv bei deiner Entwicklung;

  • Du wirst mit erstklassigen Cybersicherheitsspezialisten in unserem CERT zusammenarbeiten

Möchtest du unser Team als unser neuer MSP Partner Manager (m/w/d) verstärken? Dann würden wir uns freuen, von dir zu hören!

jobs.title: Senior Group Financial Controller (f/m/x)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Eye Security

Eye Security is providing cybersecurity with embedded cyber insurance solutions for organizations in Europe. Headquartered in the Netherlands, we are already over 170 FTEs and continue to grow internationally.

We combine cutting-edge technology with hands-on expertise to detect, respond to, and recover from cyber threats in real time. Our team brings together talent from intelligence, military, tech, and consulting backgrounds — all united by a shared mission: to make enterprise-grade cybersecurity accessible to every business, not just the big players.

At Eye, you’ll work on projects with an international footprint, solving real-world challenges and helping to build a safer digital future for our clients.

About this role

We’re looking for a Group Financial Controller (f/m/x) to lead and scale our controllership function as we enter our next phase of growth.

This is a senior leadership role for someone who thrives in fast-paced, hands-on environments. You’ll take full ownership of building a future-proof finance backbone — driving accuracy, automation, reporting, governance, and especially strong revenue recognition practices tailored to SaaS.

You’ll work closely with the VP Finance, CFO, and leadership across the company to ensure our financial systems, processes, and team can support sustainable scale. From monthly close and IFRS compliance to Chargebee automation and ERP integration — you’ll be responsible for building structure where it doesn’t yet exist, and improving what already does.

This is a hybrid role based in the Netherlands or Germany, ideally near one of our hubs (Amsterdam, The Hague, Eindhoven, Berlin, Duisburg). It includes occasional travel to London or the Netherlands.

What you will do

  • Lead financial control & reporting: Oversee the month-end close process across multiple entities and currencies. Consolidate financials and deliver accurate, timely, and compliant reporting under IFRS.

  • Own revenue recognition: Define and enforce revenue recognition policies. Partner with RevOps, Sales, and Product to ensure recognition rules align with subscription models and are accurately implemented across systems.

  • Drive financial system improvements: Lead improvements in Chargebee, ERP (e.g. NetSuite), and PowerBI, ensuring our finance stack scales with us. Identify manual processes and champion automation.

  • Establish budget accountability: Set department-level budget guardrails, monitor spend, and ensure cost discipline. Partner with People Ops and business teams on headcount and resource planning.

  • Lead a high-performing team: Manage and grow a distributed finance team, starting with our Netherlands-based GL and transactional finance colleagues. Set clear goals, build consistent processes, and foster a collaborative, performance-oriented culture.

  • Support strategic decision-making: Act as a key finance partner to the VP Finance and CFO. Contribute to board reporting, forecasting, investor updates, audits, and due diligence processes.

What you will need

  • Qualified accountant (ACA, ACCA, CIMA, or equivalent)

  • Significant experience in financial control, reporting, and systems ownership, ideally in international settings

  • Familiarity with SaaS revenue recognition principles (MRR, ARR, deferred revenue)

  • Hands-on experience improving processes and automation in tools like Chargebee, NetSuite, Xero, or similar

  • A builder mindset with the drive to scale processes in fast-growing environments

  • Proven ability to manage distributed teams and coordinate across functions and geographies

  • Excellent communication skills and stakeholder management across technical and non-technical teams

Nice to have

  • Experience in a B2B SaaS company

  • Exposure to private equity or VC-backed environments

  • Working knowledge of IFRS, especially revenue recognition standards (e.g. IFRS 15)

What we offer

  • A meaningful mission: protect organizations across Europe from real-world cyber threats

  • Work with top-tier professionals from national CERTs, intelligence agencies, and leading tech backgrounds

jobs.title: SOC Analyst (Hybrid or Remote) - Netherlands or Germany
jobs.descriptionHtml:
SOC Analyst (m/f/d) – Eye Security

As a SOC Analyst at Eye Security, you monitor alerts, separate real threats from noise, and make sure our clients stay protected – ideally before an incident even occurs.

You’ll work with clients from various industries, follow a structured onboarding, and learn directly from seasoned experts with backgrounds in intelligence and the military. We believe in a modern and transparent culture – progressive, open, and team-oriented. No silos, no finger-pointing, no hierarchy games.

👉 Important: You need strong German or Dutch skills to communicate with our clients. Internally, we speak English.

Your responsibilities

  • Analyze incoming security alerts from tools such as EDR, CDR, ASM, and others, and identify true threats in the noise.

  • Distinguish between false positives and real risks, documenting your assessments clearly and thoroughly.

  • Collaborate closely with experienced colleagues to continuously improve our detection rules and response playbooks.

  • Contribute to automation and process improvements – for example through SOAR or custom scripts.

  • Leverage threat intelligence to better assess alerts and identify potential attack vectors early on.

  • Continuously learn and grow – through real-world cases, structured onboarding, and knowledge-sharing within the team.

What you bring

  • Hands-on experience in Security Operations – gained through studies, training, or relevant work experience.

  • Solid technical understanding of IT infrastructures, networks, and operating systems.

  • Ideally, some experience with EDR, SIEM, or SOAR tools.

  • Genuine motivation for real security work – no simulations, no boredom.

  • Excellent German and/or Dutch skills (C1 or higher) and good command of English.

  • Flexibility to work in shifts (typically 8–16 or 10–18) as part of our 24/7 SOC coverage.

  • Willingness to take part in out-of-hours on-call rotation (approx. every 6–8 weeks, with fair compensation).

What you can expect at Eye Security

  • Experienced colleagues with backgrounds in intelligence, military, and leading SOCs.

  • A steep learning curve through real-world cases, diverse clients, and intensive onboarding.

  • Flexible working: from Berlin, The Hague, or 100% remote.

  • A progressive company culture: flat hierarchies, openness, and trust.

  • Strong work-life balance: flexible schedules, additional leave (e.g., for volunteering), and team retreats.

Interested?

Just send us your CV or LinkedIn profile – no motivation letter needed. We’ll get back to you shortly.
